name: layer
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: layer
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a level of material, such as a type of rock or gas, that is different from the material above or below it, or a thin sheet of a substance

example.eg: A thick layer of clay lies over the sandstone.
example.egtrans: 沙岩上面有一层厚厚的黏土。

example.eg: There was a thin layer of oil on the surface of the water.
example.egtrans: 水面上有一层薄薄的油膜。

example.eg: We stripped several layers of paint off the door.
example.egtrans: 我们从门上剥落了好几层漆。

dsense.name: layer
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the group of people at a particular level in an organization

example.eg: We've cut the number of management layers from five to three.
example.egtrans: 我们把管理层次从五层砍到了三层。

name: layer
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…按层排列，把…分层放置

example.eg: Layer the pasta with slices of tomato.
example.egtrans: 把西红柿片分层摆放在意大利面里。

trans_examp.trans_en: to cut hair so that some top parts of the hair are shorter than the hair underneath, to give it a particular style or shape

example.eg: Can you layer it a little at the front, please?
example.egtrans: 能请你把前面的头发剪出一点层次吗？
